intro: Hieracium atratum subsp. arrectipes, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often glandular-dotted. Its flowers are yellow, forming dense clusters at the ends of the stems, and it is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and open habitats. This subspecies is distinguished by its upright growth habit and the presence of bracts beneath the flower heads.
